thread.title: Grayshott Cricket Club: judges' comments
thread.title_full: Grayshott Cricket Club: judges' comments - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Grayshott Cricket Club: judges' comments
text: Superb sausage rolls, delicious chilli beef and wonderful malt loaf delighted judges Gareth A Davies and Xanthe Clay when they had tea at Yorkshire Tea Great Cricket Tea Challenge finalist Grayshott CC. Gareth A Davies Delicious tea. The home-made cakes, produced by seven or eight club members and their wives and girlfriends, were beautifully prepared; the sausage rolls were scrumptious and the chilli beef was just exceptional. Thankfully, for the first time in a few weeks, there was no arm-wrestling with Mike Gatting, as Xanthe delicately shredded cake and nibbles of sandwiches. Xanthe Clay It was pretty fabulous. The club work as a team to put this tea on the table – lads as well as ladies. The high spot was Karen Sampson’s home-made malt loaf, while another delight was Vanessa Riley’s marinated strips of chilli beef. It was really great to hear how many of the village are involved in the cricket club and their teas; they have well over 200 people involved. This is a real hub of the community. Vaughan's verdict: three-tier sponge Each of the six Great Cricket Tea Challenge finalists bakes a cake for former England captain Michael Vaughan. Laura Hurrell’s sponge featured a Victoria sandwich with a decorative cricket ball on the top, an apricot sandwich in the middle and a lemon drizzle sandwich base. Micahel Vaughan says: "Wonderfully presented and the taste to match. It just demanded you have at least one more piece." Meet the other Great Cricket Tea Challenge finalists » • Morton Colliery CC • Ebernoe CC • Bishop Thornton CC • Uffington CC • Newton Linford CC
